name: unsociably
content:
unsociably adverb
(NOT FRIENDLY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that shows someone does not like to meet people or spend time with them: She was an unsociably solemn child who found it difficult to make friends. They stood unsociably far apart, not looking at each other.

unsociably adverb
(AT UNUSUAL TIMES)
happening at unusual times, for example very early or very late : A hotel stay the night before an unsociably early flight gives you a head start on your holiday. There are concerns that this change may lead to unsociably early start-times.
